Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were.  Where might he go? Choices:  A: race track B: populated areas C: the desert D: apartment E: roadblock<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>Input: Lizard has a litter of puppies that has 5 females and 3 male puppies. Five days ago Lizard gave birth to her puppies, now Lizard has another litter, what is the ratio of females to males the second litter?<n>Answer: 1:1 if you know about math sooo I don't know<n><n>### Response<n>Response: A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You are given a set of coins as your payment for a job. How much less money are you paid compared to a set in which you replace one 500 rupee note for two 100 rupee notes? <n>Input:<n>6 100 10<n><n>Output:<n>100 - 100 0 <n><n>### Demos:<n>Input:<n>4 10 2<n>Output:<n>4 - 6 14<n><n>### Instuctions<n><n>Input:<n>The sum of two consecutive number is 24.<n>Find the numbers.<n><n>### Demo:<n>Input:<n>32<n><n>Output:<n>31, 33<n><n>### Instutions<n><n>Output:<n><n>### Demo<n><n>Input:<n>4 - 2<n><n>6 - 4<n><n>Output<n><n>### Instution<n><n>Input:<n>2 -2<n><n>3 -2<n><n>### Demo <n><n>Input:<n>16<n><n>32<n><n>### Instructon<n><n>Input:<n>6 + 9<n><n>7 + 9<n><n>### Demo

Your first choice of programming language is the Excel formula to calculate the customer's interest for a month.  Your manager asks you, "Does Excel calculate the interest using the monthly accrual method, or using the end-of-month accrual method?"<n><n>### Your Answer:<n>Microsoft Excel formulas work off of the data entry date.  It doesn't matter what the month is because it works with a specific date like the 15th of June.  They don't use the beginning of the month or the end of the month that is why excel is not good enough to calculate interest.<n><n>### Another Choice<n>You work for a bank and you use Excel formulas to calculate customer balances.  One month, after your calculation of a customer's balance, you discover that your calculation was incorrect.  After double checking that your formula is correct, you suspect that the problem is because of how you formatted your date. Your manager asks you, ''Why does my formula not work?''<n><n>### Your Response:<n>You suspect that the problem is that the formulas work off of the date.  The month will not start on the first day of January so the formula will not function properly on the first day of the month because the date already exists in the date of January.<n><n>### An alternative choice<n>You work for a software company and you help a customer solve the algorithm problem

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Jamie wanted to reduce her waist size, but all of her efforts failed miserably. Choices:  A: ocean B: symphony C: band D: music store E: music shop<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is "A."<n><n>* The ocean would include many different species, but no cellos.<n>* A symphony orchestra would include a cello, and therefore could not include someone playing the celo.<n>* The band would not include a cello, but may include members of the symphony playing outside their regular roles.<n>* A music shop could sell instruments, but probably not live ones.<n>* A music store could sell live instruments, but not necessarily a cello.<n>

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:I'm looking for alcohol and fried foods, any suggestions? How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Sometimes fighting inflation isn't even what, because it is so negligible? Choices:  A: economic instability B: not noticeable C: spend more D: rising interest rates E: boring<n><n>### Response:		<n>When talking about inflation, it is generally said that inflation is the increase in prices of the goods and services available in the economy. The causes of inflation are often divided into three categories: demand-pull, cost-push, and built-in inflation. Demand-pull inflation results from high (aggregate) demand and/or low supply. Cost-push inflation occurs when costs of resources, such as labor or raw materials increase. Built-in inflation occurs when the government requires cost-of-living adjustments to wages and prices. The goal of government inflation measures is to keep the overall increase in prices moderate, avoid the destabilizing effects of inflation (uncertainty, market fluctuations), and prevent any negative consequences of deflation or disinflation.<n><n>### InputSometimes fighting inflation may not be as easy as one would think? Choices: A: it may not always work B: the fight may be very challenging C: it can be challenging to keep inflation rate down to moderate value D: the fight may not always be possible for everyone<n><n>### Response<n><n>There are many different ways to fight against inflation and to prevent the economy moving toward an inflationary situation. Some of the ways include reducing money supply, increasing money supply, controlling interest rates, and controlling the trade balance. Money supply is basically the total value of money available in the economy in different forms such as money in circulation, bank deposits, credit cards, etc. In case the inflationary pressure intensifies, the central banks should reduce money supply in order to contain further inflation as it does not help to solve the problem but instead, it makes the problem worse since money supply will be out of control and the level of interest rates will go down. On the other hand, there is no solution to inflation which is so high that we could say it is an emergency situation, but it is possible to stop it, which can only be achieved by reducing money supply to moderate levels.<n><n>### Answer:<n>In order to keep inflation under control, the central bank will need to raise the interest rates. If the interest rates go up, the cost of borrowing money will go up as well which will result in lower demand for various goods since people will have less money to spend on these goods. This in turn will bring the inflation down and prevent it
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What is necessary for learning by yourself? Choices:  A: exposure B: patience C: study D: cooperation E: thought<n><n>### Response:		<n>There are many different aspects to any skill or ability. In order to be successful at something, you have to have exposure, patience, and study, but also teamwork and thought.

Total of 20.<n>1-6-7=14, and the last number is 14 + 14=28, so subtract 28-14=14. Then 14+1=15.<n>Add 10,000 to 900 and you get 10,900.  Divide 10,990 by 10,9,00 and you get a remainder of 900.<n>So 1385/13=106.  And that's 106 plus the 5/10 it rounded to.

Input is the data you want the code (script) to collect and the output will be the result of the code that should be returned to the user. There is only one output with this task because the value in any other way is unknown and the answer will not be used by the computer in the script.<n><n>Write the script below in the task where needed.<n>```<n>import math <n><n>Input: Someone lacking immortaility will one day be?<n><n>if Input == "kick the bucket"<n>    Output = "Dead"<n><n>elif Input == "mortal"<n>    Output = ""<n><n>elif Input == 'can die'<n>    Output ="C"<n><n>else<n>    Output = "E"<n>```<n>

Answering the question "What's the first thing you think of when you hear the word add" would help.<n><n>### <n>##### If you need help, type question mark followed by a space and your problem, and we will respond with more details.<n><n><n><n>### Input<n><n>What's something you can do with a hammer, but not with a screwdriver?<n>What kind of nails does a carpenter use?<n>Does your hammer have a picture of a beaver on it?<n><n>### Response <n><n>> nail and hammer would be the same except if you have the nail and don't have the hammer to fix it but if you have the hammer then you don't need the nail. I could also say put a nail in a box, but you might not need to but you can.<n>> A screw driver can be used to fasten a screw to a surface. But a hammer has two things that can be used as a tool. First as a striking implement to drive home nails and other fasteners and second as a hand tool to manipulate or shape objects, such as sheet metal or nails.<n>> The picture of the beaver on the hammer might not be on your hammer for your house or to see, it would be to signify the manufacturer.<n><n>### Help<n>> Is this a survey or you just trolling. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:He was in a cabin in the woods, through the window he saw a fox where? Choices:  A: indiana B: england C: outside D: on the wall E: picture<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The first thing students must do in a lab is record the data. In the same way, teachers must record the students’ performance and make necessary comments on lab report writing.<n><n>### Observation:<n>1. The student used a tape to fix his hair.<n><n>### Answer:<n>This is one of the methods of assessing students. To begin, ask yourself questions, such as- What was the student doing? Or what did the lab report help the student know? After you’ve answered the question, begin to record the student’s response into the lab report.<n><n>### Explore:<n>You can also explore the answer and then record it. However, it may not be wise to try your hand on lab report writing. First, you need to know what you must record, then look for the answer, then record it. If the student recorded the wrong answer, the teacher can explain.<n><n>### Question:<n>A: Can you observe another student performing a lab?<n>If so, what is that student doing?<n><n>### Answer<n>When it comes to data entry on lab report writing, you must consider where the data is entered. The data may be manually input or computerized. To have accurate lab report writing, manually insert the information. But if the students record data, you can either record it manually or computerized. Computerize to save time and make the process easier.<n><n>### Conclude:<n>You concluded the student's report. For a lab report to be good, it should reflect the student’s knowledge. If you wrote this as a student, how would you feel?<n><n>### Ask:<n>If you were a student, what would you ask the teacher to do on your report?<n><n>### Comment:<n>If the students ask you such questions, do not give vague responses. This is important because lab report writing is the first step in the learning process where students write reports based on their experiences with data.<n><n>### Data Entry:<n>Students often record data in an inappropriate manner. To record the data of lab report writing accurately, students must record it as it happens. If the student makes the recording, it will be incorrect because he will misinterpret the statement or even forget some part.

I should have to go to college because it is important for me to do what my mom did and what my father did.  How do you think my parents thought?  What will you do?  What are you going to tell your parents?<n><n>### Demo: My parents would not be able to pay my rent on time.  This means that I could not pay my electric bill. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What would an adult man do to get ready for work? Choices:  A: dress herself B: shower C: dress himself D: drink beer E: drive train<n><n>### Response:		 C<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: The cost of each individual pack of gum is $1.00.  How many packs of gum does she need to buy if she wants to have $6.00 total?  Answer: 6<n><n>### Response<n><n>**Answer: A.**<n><n>

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. He didn't want any meat for it.  Where might Simon be taking the cow? Choices:  A: countryside B: city C: dairy farm D: butcher shop E: canada<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If we are to assume he has bought the cow, then D is the only answer. We know he is taking the cow out of a city and going to some place far less urban, but he isn't going to a dairy farm within the city. He does, however, buy the cow because he wants to put it to work at some other point in the story.  He is definitely planning to sell it, but we know that doesn't happen either from his reaction to the story.<n>   <n>

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What is a great, but non-specific, overall benefit of exercise? Choices:  A: good health B: heart attacks C: relaxation D: rest E: fatigue<n><n>### Response:		Choice: B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a brief (no more than 100 words) response to the question.<n><n>## Explanation<n>#### [ ] Include a link to your response in the comments below. Your response should be included in the body of the response comment, not as an appendix in the document you upload.<n>#### [ ] Upload an ASCII art picture of a cat for use in our discussion.<n><n>## Conclusion<n>#### [ ] How did you apply the concepts of ____ in the exercise?<n><n>#### [ ] What was the key insight that you gained from this exercise?<n><n>#### Please attach your response:<n><n>#### <n><n><n>### Source<n>https://github.com/donnell-mr/codefellows/raw/master/2017-1-1436174796127/Class_Code/week_4/Assignments.zip<n>

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would you be going if using a parking lot near a roller coaster? His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:A night owl is what you'd head at sunset and you'd hear a what at sunrise? He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:The priest pushed for more orthodox behavior, what kind of behavior was he trying to stop? Choices:  A: liberal B: heretical C: recalcitrant D: conservadox E: heretical<n><n>### Response:		Answer: B, Heretical<n><n>

Choices:  A: asia B: southern hemisphere C: planet D: east E: earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>* If the Input is 'C' the response would be 'B' since B is only the first half and the second can't be answered by one letter that it is in the Southern Hemisphere<n><n>* If input is 'D' the response would be D since as said above it is not an answer to the question.<n><n>* if input is 'B' then the response would be A since A is the first half of the question<n><n>* If input for question is 'D' for the input "Find the Indian Ocean" the following are acceptable responses as it is too vague. The more specific the question, the better the response. So it would be helpful to provide the name of the Ocean being searched.<n><n>### Input : Find the Indian Ocean<n>Input: The city of San Francisco lies near the coast of California. By what percent was Tom overdrawn in his account? Choices: A: 161 percent B: 20 percent C: 33 percent D: 143 percent E: 250 percent<n><n>### Response2:The input said Tom was overdrawn in his bank account at the end of the week. However, the amount in his account $10 minus $1 equals $9 less which is a -11 percent.<n><n>### <n><n>### Input3:Two trains, traveling in opposite directions, meet each other. One train is 1100 meters long. One train is 200 meters long. After the meeting, how much longer is the first train than the second  train? Choices: A. 1100 millimeters B. 1300 milliamperes C. 200 meters D. 320 miliamphours<n><n>### Response3:After an explosion of the two trains, at first glance it is evident that the second train was shorter than the first train because the second train was the shorter train and they meet each other as stated.<n><n>### #Input4:Four 44-foot truss bridge sections need to be installed on a 300 foot span.  What piece of each truss  section will make the  complete bridge? <n><n>### Response4:Since each truss section is 44-foot sections, after piecing each truss section together, there would be three truss sections to make a complete bridge which would be 3 truss section with width 128 feet.<n><n>### Bonus Instruction<n><n>There is one additional input that is not shown or described<n><n>### BonuResponse<n><n>There is no bonus response<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would you find people gathered near liquid in a workplace? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Instructions:This task will introduce you to loops, a method by which programs can operate repeatedly on a set of data and perform the same task many different times.  Use the input and your knowledge of loops to fill in the blank on the following line of code.<n><n>### Test Cases:<n><n>Input: 40<n><n>Solution:4!<n><n>### Output:<n>The number of permutations of 4 elements<n><n>### Instructor Explanation:<n><n>The goal of the loop is to calculate the number of permutations of _X_ inputs given by an _X_ input length.<n><n>In this case, the _X_ input can be anything from 4–10.<n><n>Let's start with 2 inputs, 2! = 2.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Inputs are numbers of which you can have any 4 integers.<n><n>They should not contain spaces.<n><n>### Sample Inputs:<n>40;<n>42; 50; 5<n><n>### Sample Outputs:<n>4!<n>42!<n>40!<n><n>### Instuctor Testing:<n><n>Input:40<n><n>Soluion:4!<n><n>Input:42<n><n>Solution:521<n><n>Output:4!<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:You can read a magazine where while waiting for your transportation on rails to arrive? Choices:  A: train station B: bookstore C: newsstand D: waiting room E: airport<n><n>### Response:		<n>```ruby<n><n>def solution(x)<n>    if (x == "train station")<n>        if (x == "bookstore")<n>        print("Yes I can read a magazine while waiting for my transportation onrails to arrive.")<n>        <n>        if (x!= "bookstore")<n>            print("I will only read a magazine while my transportation on rails is arriving."<n>                    " "<n>                    "Please excuse my rudeness but i just have that urge to read a magazine.")<n>        end<n>        end<n>        if (x!== "bookstore")<n>         print("I will only look at my phone until my transportation on rails arrives.")<n>            end<n>        end<n>          if (x!= "waiting room")<n>            print("There's no way you can read a magazine while sitting down at the waiting room with me. i will be watching a show on my phone.")<n>                end<n>            end<n>            <n>        if (x=="waiting room")<n>        print("I will only watch the news")<n>            end<n>        <n>        if((x== "airport"))<n>        print(" I will only play games on my phone as we wait for transportation on rails to come.")<n>            end<n>            end<n>      if (x == "newsstand")<n>         print(" No sir I could read a magazine if your transportation on rails arrivethere but not at this "<n>                          "moment in time, I will be waiting for the transportation on rails.) <n>                       " )         <n>        end<n>        return x<n>    end<n>end<n>solution("A")<n>solution("B")<n>solution("C")<n>solution("D")<n>solution("E")<n>```

Draw a diagram to show your calculation of the number of tulips that will be left in two weeks.<n><n>### Input<n>Judy planted 5 tulips in her garden.  After one week, they grow to triple their size. So it’s seven days because the first week is 7 days, I multiplied the total number of weeks.<n><n>2.   I counted the times the tulips grow  and they grow more than 1 time during the one and half week that the total number of tulips is 15.<n><n>3.  I know that my answer is correct because I’m making sure that I’m adding the correct answer.<n><n>### How many tulips do you need to buy?<n><n>Judy plants 5 tulips and  how much does she have to buy to have 18?<n><n>### Instructor:<n>4. I started counting a week from now is week 8 so the number of tulip is 18 x 1 + 18 x 2 so the total number of tulle is 162 so its wrong<n><n>### How much do you need to buy

Choices:  A: stripes B: seat belts C: breaks to help stop D: tires E: radios<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would do something like this<n>var m = document.getElementById("Mary");<n>m = "How many stickers does Mary Have"; <n><n>var z = document.getElementById("Zach");<n>z = "How Much More Money Does Zach Need";<n><n>var m2 = document.getElementById("Mark");<n>m2 = "How Many Total Legs Of Animals";<n><n>var j = document.getElementById("josh");<n>j = " How Much Money Does Josh Have Left";<n><n>var ger = document.getElementById("George");<n>ger = "A bowling team has to score";<n><n>Answer all the questions on the page using only the information and tools on the web page. Make sure you do your best to explain how you got the answer for each of the questions.<n>var a = document.getElementById("A").value;<n>var b = document.getElementById("B").value;<n>var c = document.getElementById("C").value;<n>var d = document.getElementById("D").value;<n>var e = document.getElementById("E").value;<n><n>Answer: a = "Stripes are important";<n>b = "Seat belts are important";<n>c = "Brake are important";<n>d = " Tires are important";<n>e = " The radio is important";<n>    }
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:When a newborn's eyes open for the first time it will be the first time the ever? Choices:  A: tear up B: see light C: fill with tears D: be happy E: glass over<n><n>### Response:		C<n>

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:The billionaire donated a large sum to his former college, this allowed them to construct a new science what? Choices:  A: airport B: gotham city C: london D: city E: gas stations<n><n>### Response:		<n>* A is red - telephones are always at an airport<n>* B is red - a telephone is always at gotham city<n>* C is blue - telephones are not always at london or London.<n>* D is red - a telephone is always at city<n>* E should be blue - its not always at gas station<n><n>### Input : Find the two-digit number, whose ones digit is the sum of the two digits<n><n>### Response :<n><n>### Instructions : The task below describes a puzzle. Solve the puzzle and write a response that accurately completes the request<n><n>### Demstration <n>Given a string of 3 characters, with the 3rd character having 3 or more different variants, write a function that reverses a string<n><n>### Solution :<n>We have function for taking input string and return reverse string of it.<n><n>```<n>for loop goes here<n>```<n><n>### Inputs : How does adding water affect the temperature of coffee? Choose the best answer.<n>A: It gets even hotter<n>B: It gets cooler<n>C: Nothing happens<n>D: It feels more pleasant<n><n>### Output:<n><n>A: The coffee is still hot, but it might turn to boiling or become scolding if put in boiled water.<n>B: It doesn't matter how hot or cool the water is, you can usually cool some tea or coffee quite quickly by pouring it in cold water.<n>D: Water will make coffee feel cooler, but in the long run, will make it warmer.<n><n>### Note(Coding):We are just checking whether the input is string or array<n>```<n>String s = "";<n>String s1 = new String("A");  <n>String s2 = new String("B");  <n>String s3 = new String("C");<n>String s4 = new String("D");<n>for (String str: s1.toLowerCase.split("s")){<n>    System.out.println(str);<n>}<n>```<n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What is someone unintentionally hurting someone else but unable to stop likely to feel? Choices:  A: empowering B: regret C: despair D: glee E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		<n>Response 1<n><n>C#<n><n>```csharp<n>        Console.WriteLine(input[0].ToUpper());<n>```<n><n>This should work.  (If not, see below.)<n>Response 2<n><n>### Input:`George's bowling team` is an instance of `Class`.<n>### Instruction:`What is someone unintently hurting someone else...` is a call to the member function `ToUpperMethod`, which returns a `string`.<n>### Instructions:`10,448` is an instance of type `object`.<n>### Instructn:`(if` not is a conditional statement and returns a `bool`.<n>### Instruption:`... and unable to stop likely to...` is a call member function return `string`.<n>## Instruction:`... and unable to `stop or stop` the use of`...`.<n>### Instuction:`empowering...` is an instance of the member function `CapitalizationMethod` that returned a `string`.<n><n>Response<n><n>Response 1<n>```csharp<n>if (typeof(Class)[0].ToString().ToUpper() == input[0].ToUpper())<n>    Console.WriteLine("A");<n>else<n>    Console.WriteLine(input [0].ToUpper()); <n>```<n><n>Response 2<n>```csharp<n>Class [] cntr = new Class [] { 1, 2, 3, 4 }; int i = cntr.GetLength(0);<n>foreach (var item in cntr)<n>{<n>	Console.WriteLine(item);  <n>}<n>Console.ReadLine();<n>```<n><n>

She spent $0.14 on oranges and $19.00 on apples<n><n>## Demo: If she spent $0.10 on apples and $0.80 oranges.<n>She spent $4.35 on fruits or $14.65 for 2,6,8,2,4,2,2<n><n>## Demo: She spent $3.00 on appes, $4.00 for oranges and $10.00 on appels.<n><n>## A: 5 oranges cost $4.00, 5 apples cost $3.00, 12 bananas cost $8.00<n>$5.00 + $3.00 + $8.00 = $16.00. Choices:  A: pet store B: parking lot C: woodland D: north america E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>if(a){<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input;<n>```<n>John needs money, how many chickens did he have to have  to buy a car?<n>```<n>```<n>Choices:  A: 360 B: 342 C: 393 D: 540 E: 378 F: No answer<n>```<n>### Demonstraion<n>```<n>if(hundreds of chickens){<n>  <n>}<n>```<n>If (hundreds of chicken x 100) =>  what<n>```<n>0=>100*0<n>1=>100*1<n>2=>100*2<n>3=>100*3<n>4=>100*4<n>5=>100*5<n>6=>100*6<n><n>7=>100*7<n>8=>100*8<n>```<n>```<n>10-5=5  => 500-50-50= 450<n>```<n>```<n>500 = B <n>450 = C <n>360 = E <n>342 = A <n>393 = F<n><n>360<n>```<n><n>## How many times does the expression `a*b*(a+b)` evaluate to 170?<n>```<n>0!<n>1!<n>2!<n>3!<n>```<n>```<n>0!=>0<n>1!=>1<n>2!=>2<n>3!=> 6<n>0(1+(1))<n>0(2+(2))<n>```<n>```<n>3*2 ==> 6<n><n><n>```<n>If 10 = 74*3 then what is 30?<n>```<n>The expression for 30 can be expanded to  `sum(n(n+1))  with respect to 74)`  <n>```<n>30(1)<n>20(2)<n>10(3)<n>```<n>```<n>20(2)=30<n>10(3)=30<n>30=60<n>```<n>## What is the difference between a 3-digit number and a 4-digit number?<n>If 3, 5, 6, 1, 6, 2, 3 are

Choices:  A: read B: passenger C: land plane D: fly the plane E: buy tickets<n><n>### Response:		 E<n><n>### Input Choices:  A and B<n><n>### Response Choices:  C and D<n><n>### Input And Response<n><n>### Input : How much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?<n><n>### Response And Input : Woodchucks cannot chuck trees.  But they can chuck 5 trees per hour.<n><n>### Task : How much wood could 10 woodchucks chuck if they can all work together to chuck trees and there are no distractions?<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Task<n><n>### Input

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:If you are driving too fast on an icy road you are being what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n><n>### Response:		A)<n><n>Input:A person can use up all the money he or she has. Then the money will be spent and the money will have disappeared. So, A is the answer.<n><n>### Input:`Aaron used 12 marbles when he went to the toy store.`<n><n>### Response:`12`<n><n>### Input`Aaron uses 2 marbles when he goes to the toy store. He also uses 25 marbles.`<n><n>### Demosntration:<n>Bring the variables to an equivalent expression.<n><n>### Response`37`<n><n>### Explanation:<n>In the first expression,  `12`, the numbers 12 used will be replaced by variables `Aaron` to bring it to an equivalent expression. For the second expression,  25,  `25` numbers will be replaced by variables Aaron to make it an equivalent expression. In the first expression, we know `Aaron` used a total of 12 marbles. But we do not know the values of `Aaron`. Therefore, what happens is the numbers 12 will be added to the numerator, and all the other factors that were used, will be subtracted from denominator. In the second expression, the numbers used are `2` and `25 ` so in order to bring it to equivalent expressions, we have to bring their values to a common denominator which in this case `3`, then we take `2` and subtract `2` from numerator to bring it to `0`, and do the same for `25` to bring it to `24`. So, the values `12` and the `24` will be brought to common denominator to make `37` equivalent expression.<n><n>

Choices:  A: bad feelings B: confusion C: going to court D: hurt feelings E: sandwiches<n><n>### Response:		Choice: B - Confusion<n><n>### In this problem what are the constants?<n><n>### Identify the input.<n><n>```<n>  What I input is some numbers and the computer will calculate the answer.<n>```<n><n>### Identifying the control flow<n><n>```<n>  The control flow of this program is to ask some questions and give user some options and then compute the answer.<n>```

How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:A school is most likely to be located in what sort of zone? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: community C: building D: prague E: every city<n><n>### Response:		The answer is community.<n><n>```<n>//TODO: Complete this task<n><n>/*<n>  Input: Mark has kangaroo and goats. Kangaroo have two legs and goat have four legs. If he has 21 kangaroos and four times as many goats then what is the total numbered of legs for all kangaroo<n>*/<n>/*<n>  Response:The answer is 22<n>*/<n><n>let mark = 21<n>let kangaroos = 0<n>let goats = 0<n><n>//Add new variable<n><n>mark = mark - kangaroos<n>for (let i = 0; i < kangaroos; i++) {<n> const kangarooTotal = mark<n>  mark = mark + 2 //Goats *2 legs plus one kangaroo<n> return kangarooTotal<n><n>}<n><n>return goat * goat * 4<n><n><n>```<n><n><n>

Including multiple words like that one does not need to be capitalized, and it should not be put in double quotes.<n>3. The way to show a negative number is to put a minus sign in front of the number.<n><n>### Input1.<n>Ali wants to take a rocket to the moon. Rocket cost is $100 and takes $20 for each hour it stays up in the air. With the current fuel supply it can stay up for at least 3 hours. How long it can stay up in the air?<n>2.<n>Road costs $10 and take $20 for each block it travels. The bus travels 10 times longer than the road. How many blocks is the bus going to travel?<n>3.<n>The total of 20 coins is equal to $10 because coins are round and they are different size.<n><n>### Response1.<n>3.<n>The way to write your response in a way I need it is to take the $20 and subtract from $100 that is $80 then just divide the rest which is the 80 by the length of the roads which is 5, and that makes the answer 183.<n><n>2.<n>The way to make a negative integer is to do a minus. For example 30-10=20. <n><n>1.<n>The way to do this one is first you take 20 and divide it into 10 in order to get the answer of 2. <n><n>## Input:<n>The table below displays 134 people who live in a housing

How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:The boy was too nervous to dance, so what was he doing progressively at the ball? Choices:  A: dance like crazy B: standing still C: wallflower D: stand still E: like dancing<n><n>### Response:		<n>I wrote an algorithm for this that does the following:<n>Given that the boy could be dancing or standstill then the boy should not do progressively standing still or wallflower, so he must be doing progressively dancing or standing still.<n><n>**Example**<n><n>given that the boy was dancing then the algorithm returns he was doing progressively dancing, if the boy was standing still then the boy is doing progressively standing still.<n><n>### Problem Definition<n>The boy was progressively standing still at the ball.<n><n>### Solution<n>I wrote the following if-else conditions to test the input and based on that if condition, to run one of the following statements progressively:<n>- dance, stand still.<n>- A: dance like craziy, B: dance like crazy<n>- stand still, B: progressively standing still<n><n>### Algorithm<n>```<n>if (boy is dancing)<n>  boy is doing progressively dancing<n>else<n>  boy is doing stand still progressively<n>```<n><n>### Algorithm Description<n><n>Write an algorithm that checks whether the boy is progressively standing still or progressively dancing.<n><n>### Example 1:<n><n>Input: The boy was progressively standing at the ball.<n>Output: Progressively standing still is true.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>The boy was progressive standing at the ball. So, progressively standing still should be accepted.<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>The boy must be doing progressively standing still or otherwise the boy is dancing at the ball.<n>

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each spoonful of the cereal is worth 2/3 of a cent, and each questionnaire costs $0.90 to answer, they need to receive a minimum of $450 in returns for every spoonful of cereal given out.  How many boxes of cereal will they need to send to families to make sure that they will receive a total of at least $450 in spoonfuls and questionnaire answers?<n><n>Answer:$450/(3*90) = 500<n><n>### Instructs:<n><n>### Input 5<n><n>Which of the following are not the same shape as each other: <n><n>### A:A square. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What would a person do to help someone that is not able to speak coherently? How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:James was delayed for a couple of hours because he had a connection.  Where might his connection be? Choices:  A: company B: airport C: wall D: computer network E: love<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> A. <n><n>### Demostration:  <n>Given a number n, print the letter A if the number of the connection was A; B if the number of the company was B; C if the connection was at an airport; D if the connection was a computer network and E if the connection was at a love hotel. <n><n>If the input was 83<n><n>```<n>Answer: A.<n>```<n>if the input was 1<n><n>```<n>Answer : D<n>```<n><n>### Input : <n>Write a program that inputs names of fruits and their prices and outputs the total for the order. Here is a list of fruit and their prices:<n>Fruit Price<n>Apple $0.50<n>Apricot $1.49<n>Banana $0.35<n>Fruit Total = $1.19<n><n>Input: Apple<n>Output: $0.50.<n><n>### Input  : <n>Write a programme that takes a list of names and produces a formatted string as follows: "The names were: A, B, C, D, E, F, G"<n><n>###Input:<n>Names: James, Jack, Mary, John<n><n>###Output:<n>```<n>A, B, C,<n>```<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the question.<n><n>## Instruction<n>Write a computer program that asks a user to enter a two-digit number, and if the number is greater than 9, it prints out “It’s greater than 9!” as follows:<n>Input: 12<n>Output: It’s greater than 8!<n><n>## Instruction :<n>Write a computer program to read one line at a time from STDIN and write to STDOUT. Each time a line is read, add a zero and a period to the start and end of the line, and then print the line with the leading zero and a single period.<n>Example input/output:<n><n>Input: 24<n>Output: 0024.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Write a program that simulates a chess game between the computer and the user, where the computer plays white and the user plays black. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of foolhardy? It can better be described as what? Choices:  A: field B: alone C: small group D: solitude E: solitary<n><n>### Response:		<n>If we want a way to distinguish the input from the other options so that we know which is correct, we should insert the term __solitary__ or __solitary__ in the input. The other options could be used with some creativity, but not here. When we create the prompts, the input can be added to the question itself, making the response shorter. The response will be an answer that does meet the criteria for one of the answer options.<n><n>### Solutions<n>Option A<n>Let's call this input _solitary_, using its literal meaning. We'll use single quotes around it to make it clearer that the literal word is being used.<n>The crowd wasn't what can better be called a _''solitary''_ group of people.<n><n>Option B<n>Let's call the input _small group_ and use single quotes to make the meaning of the term clear.<n><n>The crowd wasn't that large, just a _''small''_ group of people<n><n>Option D<n>Choose _solitude_. The crowd was smaller than usual, at least for them. They were in solitude.<n><n>This is the same response. We could use _solitude_ instead of _solitary_ but it would be a smaller amount of characters.<n>The crowd wasn''t so large. They looked alone, but the group was small.<n><n>We could make this response even shorter even though it sounds odd but we know from the question above that we could use a plural form instead of a singular form.<n>The crowd wasn"'t so large. They were alone, in solitude, but the group was a small one.<n><n>Option E<n>We can only choose _solitary_ for the input.<n><n>The crowd was not that big. There was a _''solitARY''_ crowd there, at least it appeared to be so.<n><n>### Next Prompt<n><n>*Question:  Use the term you chose above to create a prompt, as in:  My house has two bedrooms, one with a queen size bed and the other with only a twin size. The family bedroom is the room with the queen sized bed. Which bedroom is the smaller bedroom? Your answer should include your term in the question.*<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>*Response:  The smallest bedroom is the bedroom with the tw

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:People were talking on the corner, who were they talking with? Choices:  A: god B: mix C: with people D: have friends E: see people<n><n>### Response:		<n>People were talking on with people.<n><n>### Input :<n>Who do you spend 80% of your time with? Choices: A: 1: family B: 2: kids C: 3: friends D: 4: siblings<n><n>### response:<n>I spend 80% to kids<n><n>### Instuction: The number shown represent how many of a certain type of thing he or she has. If you see "a" with no number, then the number of items described is unknown. If it were known, then the number would be included but the "a" would not be there.<n><n>### Example, in front of 6,000 people, he said<n><n>### Demostration:<n>A: My name is Alex H.<n>B: We are having our annual spring carnival this year for our students that is very fun. I like going to carnivals. I was born on September 24th, the year 2003. My favorite animal is a dog and my favorite color is blue. I prefer to eat pizza rather than apple pie. I hope you have gotten to know me a bit better through this letter. It was nice meeting you and I hope to see you next time. Thank you for coming to visit our town. My name is Kyle G.<n><n>### Response<n><n>A: We don’t know how many students attend your school B: I like going to carivals I was born on September I hate apple pie I hope you have got to got me through the letter Thanks

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where could you find multiple ruler that are owned by different people? Choices:  A: measure distance B: england C: office D: drawer E: desk<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The correct answer is a:measure distance<n><n>### Justification:<n>Since distance can only be measured, and multiple rulers are owned by different persons, therefore, it can be found in the office.<n><n>### Input - 8:<n>When I go shopping, I take my phone card so I can buy what I want.  If I buy 2.5 items and I spent a total of $15, how many items did I buy?<n><n>### Response - 8:<n>There are a few different ways of doing this, but because the question is about a phone card, I'm going to represent our spending dollars with dots, and the dots in a phone card will represent the spending units, the number of items I bought.  So, because I spent my 15 on two and a half items, the number of dots should be 8 and a half, so it's 5,9.<n><n>### Justifications:<n>In the phone card it said that there are $15 on it, so it represents 15 dots.  On the phone card there are 8 dots, so multiplying 15 by 8, what we get is 120, the total of the price of the two and a half items.  So, in the phone card there are two and a half dots, therefore, there are half of 120, therefore, it is the number of the dot in 120, which is 59.<n><n>## Input:Sophia's family took out a car loan for $328,000 to pay for their new car. The problem is: it costs 68 dollars to take her to daycare during the week, and on monday 12, it costs $5 to walk to school, and on Friday it costs $2 to get picked up. However, each time her parents work from home they get 11 dollars less each, and for each night that she stays with her grandparents they get 7 dollars extra. You get to work from home on Wednesdays, and your daughter sometimes has school on Monday or Friday. To maximize your earnings, what's the best schedule that you could have?<n><n>### Response<n><n>The correct answer should be D.<n><n>The first thing that I noticed was that the given schedule only allowed for 5 days a week.  Secondly, it said that there were no school days, but it said that it costs $2 to take her to school on the day of Friday.  The question was to take her from home to school (not the reverse). Because she always goes to school on Monday and Friday, those costs do not matter. If school is out on Monday or a Wednesday, then she will not take the $5 or $2 trip.  The answer is best determined after seeing that we can take into account what happens on weekends.<n><n>### Assignment:1. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where could a fungus grow and not be disturbed by sunlight? Choices:  A: under rocks B: manhattan C: toenails D: grocery store E: fallen tree<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think the only place where a fungus can grow and not be distrubed by the sunlight is choice A: under rocks.<n>

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a folding chair if you do not plan to use it and you do not have any large doors in your house? Choices:  A: roof B: school C: beach D: closet E: garage<n><n>### Response:		C <n><n><n>

He was born, raised, and attended school in the suburb of Chicago. After graduating from high school in 2017 he had a brief stint in the workforce, before making the decision to go in to medicine. While attending nursing school in 2020 he contracted Covid. He was put on a ventilator, his heart failed, and he slipped in to a coma. In 2021 after 4 days in coma, he began to awake in 2021. He will never play again. While it is unlikely he would ever be able to play again, there are plenty of people who have survived a coma without any lasting effects.<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>##### Demonstration 2:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:If you did well on the test, you might get an A as a what? Choices:  A: see work B: practice C: quiz D: school grade E: homework<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is the answer

What are you going to?  How much money I need?  I don't have any enough money!  Do you have the money?  You don't money!}$$<n>```<n><n>### Response<n><n>**What emotion does getting paying money lead to**<n>1. If I make less money to spent it, I feel frustration.<n>2. The money isn't money, it affects the same thing.<n>3. The same thing is money.<n>4. How much money money is that?<n>5. It means money and I haven't money.<n>6. I don't have job.<n>**How much money money does that lead to?**<n>1. I get job.<n>2. I am going to give the money.<n>3. How much money money I need?<n>4.
