Choices:  A: dream B: knowing C: depression D: pleasure E: nostalgia<n><n>### Response:		43<n><n>### Input::A: It was an amazing vacation: great food, beautiful scenery, warm people, and the best massage I ever got. I thought it was the best vacation ever. Until I found out it was the first time my husband paid for everything.<n>B: My massage lasted two hours.<n>C: After that massage I felt amazing.<n>D: That was such a fun party. We were in the middle of having so much fun and I got the biggest laugh that I am going to enjoy for such a long time.<n>E: That was the best vacation I've ever had.<n><n>### Response B: 44<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where could you put a dollar that would make it hard to get out without breaking? Choices:  A: cash drawer B: piggy bank C: purse D: box E: pocket<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>- Option A has a lot of currency in it. There would be a lot to get out without breaking it. <n>- Option C: has the same answers as A<n>- Option D: The box for this one could be used for a purse. The bank can hold a lot of money. The box would have to remain tightly closed for money to be stored if they didn’t want to get out. <n>- Option E: The answers for option D are the same. But this choice has 2 pockets and could hold a wallet with cash.<n>- Option B: The one for B has many other things as well. Not just cash<n>```<n>

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. If the sentence contains no error, select the response that does not contain an error.<n><n>|Error in Grammar|Error in Usage|Response|<n>|:-----------------|:-----------:|:-------:|<n>|There is a lot of|A lot of cars.|Choose|<n>|fishing in this lake.|Because of all the|<n>|It's nice |There aren’t any fish|<n>|That man is very|fish stocked with lots|<n>|angry.|of small fish|<n><n>### Choose the response in the paragraph that contains a sentence that has the same meaning as the sentence below.<n><n>|Sentence|Response|<n>|--------|:------|<n>|He will never go to the ballgame.|The boy will never watch his favorite baseball team compete in the World Series.|<n><n>### Whenever a man is called a chicken or a coward, he does not care much for the man doing the calling.|Whenever anyone calls a man a chicken or coward, the insult does not bother the man who is called either name.<n><n>### Read the sentence aloud. What does the statement sound like?<n><n>|Sentences|<n>|-------|<n>|John is a carpenter|<n><n>### You will also need to know simple fractions.  If a fraction is less than one, like the number 1/4, it is called a fraction a fraction.  If it is greater than one, it is called a multiple.  For example:<n>0.25<n>0.75<n>1.50<n>In each set of figures below the first number is the numerator, or top of the fraction, and the second shows the denominator, or bottom of the fraction.  You will find simple fraction problems on all SAT Practice Tests.  It would be easiest to understand the multiple by looking at the bottom of the fraction:<n>0.20=one half<n>0.50=one half, or one whole<n>1.00=one whole<n>1.50=one and a half<n><n>### Write two sentences using the prefix un- or in- before each of  the

Vagina, Emergency Room and Medicine Cabinet are not correct and would not be available.<n><n>***<n><n>### Input<n><n>In 1997, in what city did the first Taco Bell Restaurant open?<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>We will check the year before and after to find that first city.  Because it was 97, we need to check 96 and 98 in the year before and after.  These would be the two options that we would check using the conditionals.  After the two year checks, we would want to select the one that would be the first city, not the second city.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The response to this question would need to say, Taco Bell opened its first restaunt in 1997 in Los Angeles CA.<n><n>***<n>***<n>***<n>### Input<n>Input: Mary has an orange that weighs 10 oz. Her cousin Janet takes an orange slice from the orange. After eating the slice, Janet asksmary about the orange. Mary says that the orange weighed 9 oz before Janet took her slice. How many ounces did Janet take from the orange?<n>Output: 1<n><n>### Demosration<n><n>If we started with an 10 ounce orange, 1 ounce left and 1 ounce was taken.  This would give us 1 = 1 = 9<n><n>***<n>### Instruction<n><n>Write a response that appropriately fills in the blanks below. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Sam found a giant hole in the plain. There is 6 points difference between what score for the next round. <n><n>### Response  :<n>4 or 7<n><n>### Solution - Puzzle<n>- A = a, B = b, C = c<n>- if ( a + b) > 89<n><n>- a = ( 89 - ( a + b ) )<n><n>- if ( a * c > b + c )<n><n>- (a * c) = ( b + c )<n>- a = 2<n>   <n>Input: Mark has a bucket at home. If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would you find some swords in your house? Choices:  A: matchwinning B: cash in C: compete D: return E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- Option A: He matched the winning amount.<n>- Option B: He cashed in the winning amount.<n><n>### Input :<n>What percent of the students in class have their calculators? Choices: A:12% B:6% C:8% D:22% E:42%<n><n>### Response :  B<n><n>### Input - 11953 / 160 - 70 / 160 is divisible by<n><n>- Option A - 17<n><n>### Response - A<n><n>### Input<n>There are 110 boys in a football club. You want to split the football club into 3 teams with equal number of players. What is the minimum number of boys per team?<n>- Option A: 38<n>- Option B: 42<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input  <n><n>Kaylee earned $1 more than 1/2 the amount of money she earned last year.  <n><n>How much more money did she earn than she did last year?  <n><n>- Option A :  $4<n>- Option B: $8<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Instructions<n>Mark uses three rolls of paper towels every week for his office. His office uses three different kinds of paper towels. Mark’s office uses 52 rolls. <n><n>### Demostration:- A roll of paper towels is 70 centimetres. Each paper towel is used one meter of paper towels or more. So rolls of paper towel is three meters more three type of paper  towels. How many centimetres long is the paper towel?<n>- Option A :150 centimeters<n>- Option B : 200 centimeters<n><n>### Response B

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65. B: tree. C: nature. D: under the rocks. E: france. <n><n>Output:The snake was from<n><n>### Input<n><n>Farmer Brown was building a barn when he ran out of nails.  He knew he needed to replace these.  He made a list of all of the things that he needed for these, but he wasn't sure how much each would cost.  So, he gathered the items that he had at home and determined that each of those things was either 1 inch or 2 inches thick.<n><n>He decided to solve the problem by removing all of the things that were 2 inches and seeing which ones, combined, would give him more than the 1 inches.  He took each of the 2 inches items and subtracted each piece from it that gave him the best value.  He then combined these two items for each one of his 2 inches pieces.  If he couldn't get enough from combining, he made smaller pieces in the middle to try to get at least a single inch.  He kept doing this until he either couldn't create any more pieces of less than one inch or until he no longer needed any more pieces to be a single inch.<n><n>When he was done, he had a lot of 2 inch items left.  But, he was able to come up with an answer of 3 inches and 30.5 inches together.<n><n>How many 2 inch items were left?<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>The goal is to solve and present a story of a simple task such as buying lunch/cooking/shopping.<n><n>### Expected Respose<n><n>Answer to task in a story. <n><n>### Additional notes<n><n>* This problem is available on leetcode at: [580. Cutting Stock (Hard)](https://leetcode.com/problems/cutting-stock/)<n>

B: I was born 12 days ago. C: I have a brother called George. D: George was born in Madrid. E: I have a sister called Sofia. F: Sofia was born on a Monday.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The response should be B. Answer options could also be: C,F,E.<n><n>### Explation<n><n>The following table is one way to interpret the input answers: <n><n>A: Madrid, +12 days ago B: Now<n><n>C: I have a brother, + no info D: Madrid, -12 days ago<n><n>F: George was born, + Monday E: I have a sis, + no info<n><n><n>### Task:This is a basic question with multiple options. <n><n>### Examlation<n>We see from the examplations that the answer is B, but, the input of the options can be different.<n>

Each CD was half the price that the other cost her. Which one did her buy cheaper?<n>Answer: The less expensive one.<n><n>Input: In a basketball game, each team scores on 9 out of every 10 baskets.  There are a total of 94 points scored in the game. On average, how many points does each team score?<n>Answer:  If each player on the team scores the entire 94, each player would get 94 / 5 = 18.8. <n><n><n>Input: How many points did George score from one attempt out of the ten chances they needed to score?<n>Answer: If he makes exactly 1 out of the 10, that's 10%<n><n>### Demo 2<n>Input:How far is it from Florida to Texas as a percentage of the distance from Florida to Missouri?<n>Answer:If it's 50 miles from florida to missouri, then it's 5/10ths.<n><n>### Demo3<n>Input: If there are 7 players on a team, with 7 sticks, and each player picks 3 sticks, how many sticks are left?<n>Answer:21<n><n>### Demo4<n>Input:A group of 18 people are playing a game of scrabble.  There are enough letter tiles for each person to play 16 games of the game.  How many letter tiles does that leave for all the other games that they could play if they wanted to?<n><n>Answer: 312 (16*18-18)<n><n>### Demo5:<n><n>How many players play soccer?<n><n>### Demo6:<n>How many players play volleyball?<n><n>### Instractions: If you are in need of a 4.0 to maintain your scholarship or receive an academic award, you have to make

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? I also saw the gorilla, and, finally, the ostrich.<n>What animal did I miss?<n><n>Answer: A seahorse<n><n>### Instructors Guide:<n><n>I'm looking for more than just an answer, how did the students get there?<n>Were they able to construct a formula or were given a table to look for the answer.<n><n>### Student Guide:<n>This is a test of the programmers skills in a variety of areas. I want to see what they know, how they approach the problem and how they express it.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? Choices:  A: footloose B: sailing C: fast D: tighten E: bind<n><n>### Response:		Sailing<n><n>### Instructions:Please write a response that completes the task.<n><n><n>### Notes<n>We expect to see the following responses. (This problem can be solved by using a recursive method by using fibonacci sequence or another method)<n>Output F:The sum of the last two numbers is not even, what number is this even?<n>### Instruction<n>Write a pseudocode that describes how to determine a pattern that can be used to find the largest square with a given number of squares. <n><n>### Output: <n>**Sqr(n):** <n>**Square(n):**<n><n><n>## Pseudocode<n><n>Input: the number of squares is n<n>output: the largest square<n>```<n>create a new variable called n<n>initialize n to 2<n>create another variable called size<n>initialize size to 1<n>size = 1<n>loop the for loop from 2 to n (inclusive) <n>loop the while loop from 2 to 2 (exclusive) <n>if square(n) greater than size square (n)<n>```<n><n>## Pseudo Code:<n>Input:n is an integer greater or equal to 3  <n><n>### Instructions:<n>```<n>create a variable called L and initialize it to n. <n>loop the while L is n+2 in to 100<n>loop the for loop 0...100<n>if the number of squares is L or an odd number<n>then print "Yes, n is a Mersene prime " <n>else print "

Choices:  A: workplace B: bus station C: social atmosphere D: neighbor's house E: at school<n><n>### Response:		<n>A.  A B.  D C.  E D.   A E.  B<n><n><n>## Review: How to answer multiple choice questions<n><n>Choosing the right answer when you have been given a list of choices is one of the most useful skills that you'll need to have as a computer programmer.<n><n>### When you look at a question, you should always try to understand what it's asking you to do. <n><n>### Once you understand what the question is asking you to do, you can try to answer the question a piece at a time, one step at a time. <n><n>## Summary:How do I write a response to an instruction?<n><n>Writing a response to an instruction involves reading an instruction in your programming language and responding with a statement that will appropriately complete or respond to the request described in the instruction.  When working on a programming exercise, make sure that you read the exercise completely before writing a response.<n><n>Each exercise includes an instruction that describes your request. Read the entire exercise and answer your request.<n><n>Once you have completely read the instruction, you can go on to read the details of the exercise, including questions about what the request meant and instructions to answer specific question(s). <n><n>*  **Write a response that appropriately answers a specific question**  <n><n>  The exercise will give you a specific question and your task is to write a response. <n> <n>*  **Write an appropriate response**   <n><n>     The exercise will give you an exercise (perhaps showing part of the program) and your task is to provide an appropriate response, perhaps commenting on it. <n> <n><n>

The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What city in the middle east is known for a temple? Have a fun day<n><n>**Response:**<n><n>If I’m lucky enough to go to the library on a hot rainy days then it would be to read a book, but if not it would be ☂️ ☂️ Go to the library.<n><n>**Response-2:**<n><n>I might do all these!<n><n>Clean the house, wash the car, read a book and have fun!<n><n>### Instructions: <n>Input: George and Joe are playing a board game. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Sarah took poison by accident She found it in the cabinet and. thought that it was what? Choices:  A: drinkable B: junk food C: medicine D: antidote E: nutrient<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input :How many cents is $10.50?<n><n>### Response :40 cents<n>

Choices:  A: living room B: animal shelter C: georgia D: pet shop E: dog show<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is a classic type of multiple choice question that you have seen before.  The answer is D: a pet shop.<n><n>### Input<n>A large family is sitting at the dinner table.  <n>The father, mother and three children, ages 10, 12, and 13, are sitting at the table.  The 10-year old has a right leg that is shorter than her left leg.  At her left side of the table there's an empty chair.  There's a plate of pizza on the table at their daughter's place setting (the 10 year old).  At the father's and mother's place there are large glasses of milk.  The youngest daughter (age 13) sits to her mother's left.  She has a left hand that is shorter than the opposite hand. She's wearing a purple hat.<n><n>### Response<n>This is a classic example of an "X"Y coordinate system: X=table and Y=height of the chair. The question asks you to identify the girl in that scenario. This is the standard procedure for drawing the girl's seating arrangements and then writing the equation.<n><n>### Here's input: In the United States there are 49 states.  You'll need 52 cards.  Do you know who it takes to make the perfect team here?  Choices:  A) 8 friends B) 12 friends C) 26 friends D) 72 friends E) 144 friends<n><n>### Response;<n>The "D" answer is correct. It takes 144 friends to make one perfect team.<n>* 8 friends is the lowest that you can go<n>* 12 friends because then you have two people who are "left-outs"<n>* 26 friends because then you have four people who are "left outs"<n>* 72 friends because that leaves none to be "left-outs"

Choices:  A: bridge B: in spain C: beach D: field E: street<n><n>### Response:		The broken glass was found in the car door D<n><n>### Input<n>The average time spent studying the night before a test is 2 hours. 2 hours is added to his score on last week’s math test.  He gets an average of 95 on the weekly math quiz.  How many times can he retake the same test for 50% more of the average score?<n><n>### Response<n>The average time is 2 hours<n>The average score on quiz is 95.<n>Than 200(50%) was added on his quiz score <n>Which is<n>[1-(1/1.5)*0.5 = 4] = 4/5<n>Answer: 2.1 times<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>Gordon is 52 years old.  He exercises four times a week and averages a 3 mile per hour rate for the duration of his bike ride.  If he also does a 6 mile run each night once a week, how long will it take him to burn 1,550 calories?<n><n>### Answer: 25.4 minutes (6 mile run + 2.5 hours of bike riding) = 27.5 minute run<n><n>### Input A: A large snake can eat between 5 and 130 pounds of meat in one meal.  <n><n>### Input B: A large snake could eat between 10 and 400 bales of hay in one meal.<n><n>### Input C: A large snake may have a mass up to 450 pounds.<n><n>### Choice answers:<n><n>### D: It eats more than 200 pounds of meat in a meal.<n><n>\$ B \div A \$ will give you a minimum and a maximum number <n><n><n>### Input D:<n>An ant will gather more than 1.5 million times the amount of food as a human.   <n><n>\$ A \div B \$ will give you a range of how much an ant will gather.<n><n>### Answer D <n><n>### Input E: What is the minimum distance that a fly could fly by flapping its wings continuously for one hour?<n><n>### If a beetle runs an average
Below is an instruction that describes a task. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What creatures performing pollination are loved my millions? Choices:  A: birds B: action C: butterflies D: happiness E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		C=butterflies<n><n>### Input<n>What day of the week is June 22nd? The answer requires:<n><n>### Demostration<n>Step 1: Find the day when June starts, that in the Gregorian calendar is 1st of July<n>So, for the June 22nd, we need to find when is July 22nd<n>Step 2: Then we need to take 6 days ahead from the day of the end of the month at May 31th, which is the 1st day of June, therefore we need to take June 22nd - 6 days = June 22nd + 6 = July 4th<n>Step 3: Then we need to find when we are the same date we find the weekday in the Gregorian calendars, here we have: July 4 - October 1 is = September 22 = Thursday<n>### Response: Thursday<n><n>### Demosration<n>In a class of 48 students the average age is 20 years old. Two students left. The average age of those left is 21 years old. What was the average age of the class before they left?<n><n>### Response<n>20 + 21/47*28 = 22.15<n><n>### Demotration <n>I have 8 apples and want to give two apples to your mom, one apple to your dad and three apples to your brother. What are remaining?<n><n>### Solution<n>8 – (2 + 1 + 3) = 2<n><n>### Demestration <n>A bat and ball cost $1.10. The bat costs $1 more than the ball. Choices:  A: swimming pool B: pond C: lake D: bathe in E: childrens pool<n><n>### Response:		lake<n><n><n>### Expected output:<n>A: Lake<n><n>```<n>A: lake<n>B: childrens pool <n>C: bathe in<n>D: pond<n>E: swimming pool <n>```<n><n>### Explanation:<n>You can use <n>```<n><n>```<n>to calculate the sum of the scores of all variables.<n><n>```<n>```<n>```<n>To determine the correct response<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```<n>var pool = 0<n>pool += 1<n>var lake = 0<n>pool -=1<n>var bathe = 0<n>pool+=2<n>var pond = 0<n>pool-=3<n>var childrenspool = 0<n>pool++;<n><n>var total = pool;<n>```<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What would someone wear to protect themselves from a cannon? Choices:  A: ungulate B: bomber C: body armor D: tank E: hat<n><n>### Response:		<n>I wrote my code and I got it to work.<n><n>```javascript<n>const cannonWearing = (input) => {<n>  if(input === "A"){<n>    return "A";<n>  } else <n>  if(input.startsWith("B")){<n>    return "B";<n>  } else if (input === "C"){<n>    return"C";<n>  } <n>  else if(input.startsWith("D")){<n>    return"D";<n>  } else {<n>    return  "E";<n>  }<n><n>}<n>if(cannonWearing(input)){<n>  return "true"<n>} else {<n>  return "false"<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n>true<n>

What percent of the store’s visitors are women?<n>**Choice #1:** What percent of the store's visitors are women? 18/44 = 40%<n><n>**Choice #2:** What percent of total customers are women? 11/3 = 37%<n><n>**Choice#3:** What percent of all visitors are women? 40/18 = 38%<n><n>**Choice 4:** What percent of visitors are women? 8/18 + 11/18 = 47%<n><n>**Correct Response:** What percent of customers are women?<n><n>Input: A library has 34 total books. Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### If there is a stale odor in the air coming from somewhere close to the kitchen, check the cupboard or the space shuttle.<n><n>### Explanation: In this problem, the source of the smel is in the kitchen. The kitchen will either be dirty or clean. Since its close to the kitchen, you should check the cupboard or space shuttle. If the cupboard is stale like the kitchen, then the space shuttle should be stale also. On the other hand, if the space shuttle is stale, then the cupboard would be clean. This should help to narrow down the stale smell in kitchen.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Task:<n>Input:<n><n>### Examplation:<n>For the first day, you could eat a meal you bought at that food cart to the left and you would be 8,000 yen ($80) poorer than the day before. Choices:  A: freeway B: radio C: wires D: computer network E: electrical circuit<n><n>### Response:		<n>Your choice was correct!<n><n>### Explanation:When two devices want to share things with each other, they need to know how to talk. If your house wants to let your car know that you want to go to the park, but the car doesn't have a way of connecting to you, it may not be able understand what you want to ask it to do. It's the same thing for a computer. Your computer needs a way to communicate with all of your peripherals and devices, as well as with other computers. One of the ways your computer, laptops, phone, or other devices can connect to each other is through a Computer Network.<n><n>### If your answer is not correct, include the correct input and your rationale in the comments.<n><n>### Challenge:  Choose the correct value for x that, when added to 2 - x, equals 13.<n>### Choices: Choices: A: x = 4<n><n>### Choices2 B: x = -7<n><n>### Choice3 C: x = 5<n><n>### Choce4 D: x = 3<n><n>### D: x = -4<n><n>### Your response:<n>Your choice was incorrect.<n><n>### Excuseon:The answer is B.x=4<n><n>### Challenge2:Write a response that correctly answers the provided multiple choice question.<n>### Instruction:"Is this a multiple choice question? Choices:  A: walmart B: white house C: country D: corporation E: government<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Extension:<n>### Instruction 1:<n>### Demonstation:<n>### Input:<n>**A:** B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>**1:** Show each of the input statements and their answers as you did when you were demonstrating the prompts**<n><n>### The president is the leader of: <n>###  __[Input]:__ A <n>### __[Answer]:__ B <n><n>### __Extra space:__<n><n>### Instction 2:<n>### Demostration:<n>### Instrucion:<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>### __ [First Input]: __B  <n>### The President is: <n>### __ [Answer]: __ A<n><n>### __ Extra space  : __<n><n>### Instructin 3:<n>### Demosstion:<n>### Instructiu:<n>### __[Input]:__ D<n>### __[Extra space]:__<n>### The President:<n>### __ [Extra Space]:__<n>### __ [Input]:__ E<n>### __ [Correct Answer]:__ B<n><n>### Extra space: __<n><n>### End of Task:<n><n>### Output:<n><img src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92231142/120894571-0c8cf380-c72d-11eb-834f-f105885139fe.PNG" height="750px"><n><n><n><n><n>    ]<n>

She decides to put  $200 in the bank with a 6% annual rate of interest.  She puts $500 in her wallet which has a 12% annual rate of inflation. If she spends her salary entirely on things which will depreciate at the same rate as her salary will appreciate how much will she spend on the depreciating items in dollars?<n><n>### Response :<n>- If our input "is = 850" then the value of "the sum of the first 4 terms of the sequence (850) + (200) + (500) + (1 + r)" is equal to the $899.54.<n><n>### Requirement : Write a command that evaluates the result of the above exercise. The command should prompt the user and then output the result.<n><n>### Output: Your output should prompt the user for the input and then compute and print the result<n>Input: Mary's salary<n>is = $<n>850<n><n><n>Your bank account balance is =<n><n>The interest you will earn in 5 years is<n><n>Your bank account has $<n>850 in it<n><n>Your money is losing $<n>90 in value<n><n>Mary bought many items that will depreciate more<n><n>Faster than your money is losing value.<n>

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:James felt himself losing consciousness.  He was frightened.  He didn't want this.  He was scared of what? Choices:  A: death B: coma C: peace D: forgetfulness E: loss of life<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- A: This makes sense. The answer is "death" because "he didn't want this" means he didn't want to die and he was losing consciousness.<n><n>```ruby<n>answer = true<n>answer = false<n>puts answer<n>```<n>### Instruction<n>Your assignment must be saved with.rb extension.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. The length of the string should not exceed 50 characters.<n><n>### Examples:<n>```<n>response = "A: I wish I could stop working and retire."<n>```<n>```<n>response = `D: I'm glad I get paid for services rendered.`<n>```<n><n>This repository contains examples of solutions to problems in this assignment.

Choices:  A: trash can B: honey C: bouquet of flowers D: rose garden E: field of flowers<n><n>### Response:		If one of the choices is "a", the answer is "e".<n><n>### Input and Response:You’ve worked with a group of your friends to babysit for your family.  Your family has two kids under the age of 12 years old.  In addition to that, there are three families with one kid under 12 each.  How many total kids are being babysat?<n><n>### Input is invalid if<n>Babysit for someone under 12? <n><n>> ## Note on answers from the Internet<n>In this workshop we are working on completing and debugging code to make a computer do the job for us, and not using the computer like a calculator, which is how most programs will fail (you can always use your calculator if you need help with a math problem). When you test a program, you should be writing programs that are going to answer questions or solve problems, not the type of programs on the Internet (like the ones I show in this workshop). You can only write a program that will successfully complete all the steps when they are input as data. <n><n>It is unlikely, however that you will find a good set  of data or instructions on the Internet with exactly the same characteristics as your exercise. That is one reason the Internet data is probably no help.  For example in my question about the number of legs on an animal, I specified an animal that has 2 legs and 4 legs, so it is unlikely that there would be data on the Internet with two kangaroo's and 3 goats.<n><n>Another difficulty is that in the Internet data, it is easy to find answers that are good approximations but not always as accurate as the data in the exercises. They're not always wrong but the answers in the internet data can often change depending on the time of day, the traffic to that page and many other things out of our control. Some day later on a different computer it might not work at all. <n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:The skin was cut while chopping onions, where was this skin likely cut? Choices:  A: good health B: finger C: meat D: body E: own family<n><n>### Response:		<n>In answer to A) the correct answer is body as the onions cut the fingers as the onions are chopped.<n><n>In answer to B) the correct answer is the skin in onions is too thick to cut with any sharp utensils.<n><n>In Answer to C) the correct answer is meat as the onion is cut in the chopping process.<n><n>In Answer D) the correct answer is good health, as the skin is cut due to the sharp knife.<n><n>In Answer E) the correct answer is onions as onion cuts are easy due to the skin thickness.<n><n>### Input : What is the minimum grade that your report card needs to have a 3.0 GPA?<n><n>```<n>A+		4<n>A		4<n>A-		3<n>B+		3<n>B		3<n>B-		2<n>C+		2<n>C		2<n>C-		1<n>D+		1<n>D		1<n>D-		0<n>```<n><n>### Calculation:<n>Calculate the minimum grade that your reports card needs to have a Grade Point Average of 3.0.<n><n>### Solution:<n>The solution would be A or A- or C or C-<n><n>### Solution Explanation:<n>A report card is needed to pass the 3 points the report card gives to it the average will be 3.0<n>```<n>A	4<n>B and C	3<n>D	2<n>Both of A or B or C or D only gets the average down to 2.66, if i used C or D it will get 2.33<n>If I got it down to 2.33 it is too low because you're not going to pass with a 2.<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: new mexico B: forrest C: dessert D: garden E: creek<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I would have to go with D E: creek.<n><n>Due to the creek having fresh water and a lizard like a frog having no feet it could be surprised easily due to its lack of ability to walk on land.<n><n>### Input :<n>"Find the distance between Chicago and Seattle. Choices: A: 5380 miles B: 5320 miles C: 5300 miles D: 5350 miles E: 5330 miles"<n><n>### Response :<n><n>I would have the answer as 5350 which would be halfway between the two cities.<n><n>This is because they are both inland with high elevation. This creates a distance that takes more energy to cross as it is more uphill. So if the distance that they have would be the elevation needed to go from the starting elevation to the ending distance it would give 1060 miles.<n><n>Adding to that an extra 50 miles for a rounding error it then comes out to 5350.

How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:To learn must have the right book, to work efficiently what must one have? Choices:  A: improve yourself B: become knowledgeable C: have tools D: persistence E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>### Resources:<n>* [Mary had 89 sticky notes](https://www.khanacademy.org/math/core-computation/computational-thinking/coding/v/mary-has-89-star-stickers)<n>* [Mark had two goats and kangaroos](https://www.codecademy.com/courses/mathematically-sound-beginner/lessons/divisibility-by-2-part-2-50a9xw/exercise/1z4n6qmg/challenge-solution)<n>* [Bowling team questions](https://www.stackoverflow.com/questions/34929688/what-is-the-min-average-needed-to-score-to-tie-the-bowling-league-record)<n><n>***<n>Reference:<n>* Data Analyst<n>* Data Analyst Interview Questions and Answers

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. Each package has 50 snicker bars. The cost of each snicker bar is $5.60. How much does each snicker bar cost?<n><n>### Solution: To find each snicker bar's cost we will need the total cost of 25 snicker bars so 25*5.60=140 and then we use that in the 140=25 so 25/140 then solve for x=.18 how much each snicker bar costs

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:The game was on sale.  I got it then because it was usually what? Choices:  A: buying B: purchase C: overpriced D: way to much E: expensive<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> A. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. The peninsula forms a large natural harbor that makes it an ideal location for a naval base. <n>The Crimean Peninsula is known for its natural warm mineral springs that are located under waterfalls and has been used for its natural springs as a health resort since Victorian times.<n><n>### Response 2<n>Why the War in Ukraine was Really About Oils and Gas <n>The 90 days war in Ukraine which lasted from February 23 to September 9th, 2014 was a war that was fought because of the economic crisis in Crimea. <n>Ukraine is known for its rich and fertile farmlands.  Crimea is known as the "Pearl of the Adriatic and its fertile soil makes it a beautiful city. It's fertile soil also produces bountiful harvests. The city of Crimeans main products include: Wheat, Barley, Potatoes, Tomatoes, Sugar Beets, Sunflowers, Corn, Apples, Mushrooms, Honey, etc. <n><n>### Demostration:<n>The War in Crimea was a war that was caused by the economic collapse of Crimea which was located in the region of Crimea, a peninsula that borders on the Sea of Abrazia.<n><n>### Input 3:<n>The following is an excerpt from a letter Mary wrote to her sister and posted to your blog. My idea for

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:James needed a garage because he spent a lot of money on what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n>B) House<n><n>### Input<n><n>Choose an animal that has 4 legs. Choose that animal is a kangaroo.<n><n>### Response<n><n>A kangaroo has two legs and no goats have been considered, so a kangaroo has to have three legs.<n><n>### Input <n><n>Choose an Animal that has six Legs. Choose that is a Goat<n><n>### Response <n><n>If she has 89 stickers, 3 of those are large and the other 86 are small.  We can use an array to hold 89 stickers including the large ones.  <n>```<n>#include <iostream><n>using namespace std;  <n><n>int main(){<n>    int stickers[][3]={0};  <n>    <n>    for(int row=1; row<=89;row++){<n>        if(row%3==0){<n>            if(stickers[row-1][2]==0){<n>                stickers[row][2]=2;  <n>            }  <n>            else if(stickers[(row-1)/3][2]+1==2){<n>                stickers[(row-1)][2]=2;   <n>            }  <n>        }<n>        else {<n>            if(stuckers[row-1]==0){<n>                <n>               stuckers[row]=1;   <n>            }  else {<n>           <n>               stickers[row]=3;<n>            }<n>            <n>        }<n>        <n>    }  <n>    int total=0;  <n>  <n>    for(int i=1; i<=8;i++){<n>      total+=(stickers[i][2]);<n>   }  <n>    <n>    cout<<"A sticker to a total = "<<total;   <n>    return 0;  <n>}<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: artist junkyard B: music store C: singing D: symphony E: orchestra<n><n>### Response:		The word balalaika is a popular Russian word for an instrument like a guitar. The instrument is usually played in orchestras, but people can also perform with this instrument in bands. A group can be called balalaika. The word also contains the slang word balalaika which stands for a girlfriend. Balalaika means sweetheart in the Russian language. This instrument is known for having a long wooden neck with three strings attached. Often the instruments have four or five strings but not all of them are used while playing.<n><n>#### Reflection: How can we see the problem as a puzzle rather than a problem?<n><n>#### Resources:<n><n>* [Demonstration: Solving the Word Problem](.)<n>* [Demonstraction:How do we know if a variable is needed in a task](http://openminds.org/d1f3778f-1785-4a25-99e8-67a9894d83f4/"how-do-we-know-if-a-variable-is-needed-in-a-problem--")<n>* [Demonstracition:Using equations to solve the problem](http://openmymind.org/d1b77f51-5a6f-45cc-b940-80cc01d36ed8/"how-do-i-solve-the-word-problem/<n>

She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where is a good place to get a ball? Choices:  A: kitchen B: child's hand C: street D: toy store E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question<n><n>

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What could contain no more than around 100 people? Choices:  A: apartment B: classroom C: buildings D: car E: audience<n><n>### Response:		Apartment  <n>Choices: A: apartment B. classroom C: buildings and so on<n><n>#### E: audience<n><n>---<n><n>### Input<n>An animal is 75% larger than another<n><n>### Response <n>A dog is 75% bigger than a mouse.<n><n>---<n><n>#### Input: Choices:  A. 0 B. 1 C. 2 D. 3 E. 12<n><n>### Response<n>-    E <n><n>---<n><n># Instructions<n><n>-    Use this table to answer questions A. and B.<n>	<n>	# Instruction	<n>	<n>	If you can't put the words in your head, then put them on paper to help you know how to solve<n><n><n>### B. What is the most common color in the 12?<n><n>### A. How many more blue balls than red balls are there?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>	The most common color in the table 12 is Red which is 4.<n>	Number of balls in each colour from a to j are :<n>	 Red = 4<n>	 Blue = 2<n>	 White = 2<n>	 2 Black<n>	 1 Orange<n>	 1 purple<n>	 1 yellows<n>	 1 brown<n>	 1 gray<n>	 1 green<n><n><n>---<n><n>**[Dart 451](https://www.dart.unsw.edu.au/courses/study-at-unsw/courses/unsw-351-dart-advanced-python-programming#structure)**<n><n>

How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by only a few people recently? Surface of earth has never been breathed by anyone.<n><n>### Input：Was the last of your milk fresh? Four hours 7. Six hours 8. Three days<n><n>Choices:<n>* 4)<n><n>* Explanations:<n><n>### Input : Does your grandmother often knit wool socks?<n><n>When and what did the lady do, just to keep the wool worms from eating up her socks?<n><n>1. Just before she goes to sleep, she has the wool worm bats out.<n><n>2. Just before she goes sleep, she covers her socks with her jacket<n><n>3. She puts the wool socks inside herself.<n><n>4. The lady washes her socks with a hot iron.<n><n>### Responses:<n><n>* One before goes sleep, she covers wool socks with her jackets.<n><n>* Explainations:<n><n>* This is correct because she covered her wool socks with a jacket. <n><n>* Wool worms go into the wool socks when it's cold because it is to their liking.<n><n>###Input：A bear is climbing down a rope ladder.How many ladders does the bear stand on to get to the bottom? His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a sign with some people lined up next to it? Choices:  A: bus stop B: street corner C: roadblock D: fast food drive thru E: city<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>	A<n>```<n>### Instruction:"If they did it, you should too!"<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input 5 people<n>10 items<n><n>```javascript<n>const input = [];<n>input[0] = [10,5,15,8,30,10];<n><n>/* 5 people */<n>// first one is 1<n>// next one is 10<n>// third one is 26<n>// fourth one is 8<n>// fifth one is 30<n>// 1 + 10 + 10 +... = 110<n>console.log(sum);<n><n>// 110/5 = 22<n>// 111 + 110 = 221<n>console.log(add);<n><n>```<n>

The average temperature in the summer in the desert is 120 degrees fahrenheit and there are 40 days in the fall.  Choose the correct statement of the ratio:<n>A: the number of days in the winter with temperatures over 130 degrees:  the number of days in spring with temperatures over 80 degrees: is 30:1.<n><n><n>B: the number of days with temperatures over 30 degrees in the winter is:  the number of nights with temperatures over freezing in the summer is: is 30 nights: 6 nights. <n><n>C: the number of winter days over 100 degrees is:  the number when nighttime temperatures exceed freezing for the summer and fall combined.<n><n>D: the number of winter nights with temperatures below freezing equals:  the number of summer days with temperatures over freezin are: is equal to 30 days: 29 days.<n><n>E:the year round average temperature is:  the seasonal average temperature in the winter: is 91 degrees fahrenheit. <n><n>Input:The weather is predicted to remain warm all weekend. It will probably be a few degrees warmer in the city tomorrow than today. If the city is 1 degree warmer today than it was two days ago, how many degrees warmer will it be tomorrow than today?<n>answer answer the question using the following information: Today was ℉ = -1 Day was ℉=0 Today was ℃ = 1.023 Day was ℃=0 Yesterday was ℃==1.017<n><n>Input:Tom is going to the store to buy some groceries. Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		<n>### What does a virus do to a person: It infects a person.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>### Input #1: The temperature of an ice block 125 pounds in weight is 24 degrees. How many ounces of ice are there in the ice block?<n>Answer: 9125/180<n><n>### Response #1: How many ounces are there in the block of ice: 50.8333<n><n>---<n><n>### Input<n>Today is a special day at the circus. The animals are going to learn new things, such as the tightrope walk. A cow, a tiger, an elephant, a goat, and a chicken will each learn a new trick. Each animal will learn their assigned trick in three sessions. The cow may only go ten minutes before a break, the tiger may only go thirty minutes before a break, and the rest may go up to an hour before needing a break. We will start with a session for the elephant. The elephant goes one hour and the others are still learning. On what day of the week does the elephant finish learning, going after the chicken?<n><n>### Response<n>We would first have to figure the sequence of the tasks based on the question<n>The elephant goes last<n>Tiger and then Cow<n>The chicken is the last one.<n><n>Now with that being said based on the question how many sessions should each animal do for that task? We know that the Cow needs 10 minutes and the rest need up to an hour. Then we know that after the elephant the tiger and cow will learn and after the tiger the chicken will learn and after the chicken will be an hour long.<n><n>\#of sessions for Cow=10<n>\#of sessions after tiger is done with the task=1<n>\#of sessions left for tiger to finish=2<n>\#of sessions elephant has been able to do so far=11<n>\#of hours elephant needs=1<n>\#sessions after Elephant is done=4<n>\#of sessions chicken is able to do=3<n>\#of hours chicken can do=1<n><n>On Thursday it will be the Cow the second day the tasks would be done

Choices:  A: living B: feeling good C: hyperventilate D: look around E: breathe deeply<n><n>### Response:		<n>Breathe deeply, that is the word that best answers the question.<n><n>## [1248. Minimum Length Sum Query for a Palindromic String](https://www.hackerrank.com/challenges/minimum-length-sum-query-for-a-palindromic-string/problem)<n><n>### Instructions:<n>This problem was asked by JPMorgan Chase.<n>Implement the longest common substring query algorithm to find the longest string, that is a palindrome, that can be formed by merging contiguous substrings from the given strings, and for each such longest string, report the maximum sum of the lengths of the string.<n><n>### Example:<n>input: a = 'aab', b = 'aba'<n>output: 3<n><n>For string c which satisfies the problem constraints, the maximum length of substring such that the sum of its length is no greater than the sum in the given solution is 3, so the longest palindromic substring is of length 3, a[123]. The maximum sum of the sum of lengths of the palindromic substring for each string is 23.<n><n>### Input Format:<n>The first line of the input contains space-seprated integers n, m (1 ≤ n, m ≤ 2000).<n>The second line of the input contains an arbitrary text string a (1 ≤ |a| ≤ 20) followed by n spaces, and the next m lines contain m individual text strings b1, b2,... b m (1 ≤ |bi| ≤ 25), where i = 1, 2,... m.<n><n>### Output Format:<n>For each string from the given list of strings, return answer as a single line of space-separated double, where is the length of the palindromes that can be formed from contiguous substrings of a, b,... b m and for each such longest palindromes, is the maximum sum of the length of the palendromic strings.<n>### Difficulty: <n>Easy<n>### Notes:<n>0 <= n <= 2000<n>1 <= m <= 200<n>1 <= |a| <= 20<n>1 <= |bi| <= 25<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would a ficus plant brighten up a room? Choices:  A: middle east B: palace C: dictionary D: pots E: apartment<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is A: The middle east<n><n>### Input<n>Choose one<n>A: a 1000 piece puzzle<n>A: 3 gallons of milk<n>A: 12 cupcakes<n>A: a box of mac and cheese<n>A: a set of books<n><n>### Output<n>The answer is C: 1000 pieces in a 1002 piece puzzle<n><n>### Input  <n>Input: How many 4 ounce bags of dog food must a veterinarian buy if each of the 6 dogs in her office require 12 ounces once per day?<n><n>### Output  <n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input   <n>What is the value of 51!<n><n>```<n>50! * 51<n>```<n><n>### Output   <n>50! * Answer<n>```<n>```<n><n>## Task<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: Mary has 89 stickers she has used 3 stickers on the front cover of her journal, 7 each to the pages 6, 11, and 16, and 6 stuck to the interior pages of her journal. At first glance, she thinks, "Oh, no! My mom gave me one sticker too many and now I only have one sticker left." How much does Mary still have?<n><n>### Input 2: A man wants to buy a pencil, stapler, and 2 packs of notebook paper. The pencil costs 99 cents, the stapler costs 80 cents and the notebook paper costs $6.90. How much does the man need to spend?<n><n>### Instreaming:<n>Input: What is the area of a triangle?<n><n>### Response 1:<n>The answer was a rectangle.<n><n><n>### Response2<n><n>Input: What is area?<n><n>###Response 3<n>Input: What do you see in a rectangle?<n><n>###Output 1<n>If Mary had 89 she used 27 for page 1, then she had 62 left.<n>```<n>89 - 27 = 62<n>```<n><n>## Output2<n><n>```<n>A: A rectangle <n>B: Area<n><n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: exercise B: moving forward C: feet D: blisters E: locomotion<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The answer is C, FEET<n><n>### How do I know the answer is correct?<n><n>I have double checked the Answer choices: moving forward, feet, exercise, blisters, and locomotion.<n><n>Moving Forward would not be correct because walking does not guarantee the person walked forward the whole or even any part of the day.<n><n>Exercise could not be correct because it was walking for a long time and not exercise.<n><n>Feet would be correct because you are walking on what gives you balance and moves forward.<n><n>Blisters is not correct because while you are walking a blister could form but it will not while you are moving or walking.<n><n>Locomotion is not correct because you are physically going from one place to another with moving forward or backward.<n><n>### What's the catch?<n><n>There is no catch it could be incorrect because that is what I thought as well.<n>

Choices:  A: reverse B: backwards C: back and D: back and E: tally back<n><n>### Response:		<n>***<n><n>A.<n><n>### Input<n><n>A well-known phrase is a common saying with meaning that is understood.<n><n><n>### Response<n>A.<n><n><n>## The Expected Output<n>We expect the response to match the original instruction, if we did **not** change the sentence structure.<n><n>**This means the response should be:**<n><n>* an open-ended question, and<n>* one that has a specific number of choices.<n><n>### The Instruction<n><n>`Answer the following multiple choice questions.`<n><n>The sentence structure of this instruction is:<n><n>'Answer' (Verb)<n><n>'the following multiple choice questions' (Prepositional Phrase)<n><n><n>### Expected Output<n>This is what we expected to read in the response:<n><n>Answer multiple choice questions.<n><n>We do not expect the person to match words from the instruction. We need a response that matches the sentence structure of the instruction. For example,<n><n>The response should look like this:<n><n>Answer multiple _______ questions.<n><n>With the blank filled in with words like 'choice,' 'options,' or 'places,' etc.<n><n>### Reasoning:<n>In this exercise, we are checking the accuracy of the person's response. We can determine the meaning of the sentence, but we need to confirm the structure of the sentence.<n>

Choices:  A: sleep in while camping B: camp ground C: woods D: bag E: backpack<n><n>### Response:		<n>- A B C D E<n><n>### Input:- How many people are in a basketball team?  Each of these people are players, but they need help. In total there are 5 more people: three coaches and two managers.<n><n>- The answer will be a range, like a group between the first two inputs.  So firstly put the minimum number of players (35) minus the number of coaches, and after we need to add the same number of people like in the second input we find a solution.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: Bob and Sarah went to buy 30 slices of pizza at The Happy Pizza.  How much was the whole pizza? The slice price is $2.35.<n><n>Input: Bob bought half a cake.  How much did it cost? The slice price is 12$<n><n>Input: Mary bought half of the whole pizza at The Happy.  How much did she buy? The price of half a slice from The Happy Pizza is 6$<n><n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a program using the code you wrote above to test your input and answer. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:while luck plays a big role, every person who is great at something has focus and what to it? Choices:  A: hatred B: surprised C: compliments D: dedication E: solutions<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### B: surprised<n>

Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n><n>### Response:		<n>> D. wash dishes.<n><n>### Input<n>> What is the next number in the sequence: 13 31 92 123?<n><n>### Response<n>> B. 65<n><n>### Instructions: In each of the following problems, write a step-by-step program that outputs the next number in each sequence.<n>### Demontrations:<n><n>Input: What is the next number: 1<n><n>Answer: 2<n><n>Input: What number is 109 more than: 1<n><n>If 109 - 1 > 0, the answer is 109, if 109 - (109-1) > 0 the answer is 1. Therefore, the answer is 99<n><n>Input: What will the next number be if this sequence is extrapolated: 0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1,25, 1.5, 1.75, 2<n>        <n>        <n>Answer: C. 3<n><n><ol><n><li>0.25 + 0.5 = 3</li><n><li>3 + 0.75 = 3.75</li><n><ol><n></li><n><p></p><n><li>1 + 1.25 = 2.25</li><n></li>3.75 + 1.5 = 5.25</li<n></li><n></ol><n></li><li>2.25 + 1.75 = 4</li><n></p><n><n><ol>2.25, 15, 600, 731, 1748, 1749.<n></li></p><n>

Choose your sentence from the drop-down menu below.<n><n>-<n><n> <n><n>  |    |<n>  | --- |<n>  |  A | You must read these instructions carefully if you want to win our weekly quiz! |<n>  |  B | Our weekly quizzes can be difficult to grasp if you haven't been careful in reading the instructions | <n>  |  C | Our weekly quiz might be too hard for you if you don't take the time to read the instructions fully |<n>  |  D | By reading the instructions carefully, you can be fully prepared to win our weekly contest! |<n>  |    | You should read the instructions carefully if you want a chance to win.<n><n><n>### Input:"There are 360 degrees in a circle."<n><n>Response:In geometry, a circle consists of all points in a plane the same distance...  An angle can be considered analogous to the radius of a circle and the central angle is analogous to the circumference of...  In spherical trigonometry, which has its origin... <n><n>### Input<n><n>"If the radius of a circle is 50 feet, then what is the area of the circle?<n><n>Radical answer: The radius of a circle is the distance from the center of the circle to any point on the edge of the circle, and is also the length of the circle's perimeter (the distance all the way around the circle).<n>The formula for the area of a circle is AC * r2 = pi*r2.<n>r represents the radius.<n>pi is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter and is equal to 3.14159<n><n>Example: Find the area of a circle with a radius of 17.5 inches by plugging in pi = 3.14 and r = 17.5 into AC * r2 = 3.1 * 17.52.<n>The circle's area is approximately 196.1 inches sq<n><n>### Input

Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n><n>### Response:		Answer A: A: flower garden<n>You could put the rose in the formal garden. It is possible. But a rosebush is too large for the formal garden, so you would need to trim the bush too short. The rosebush would not be able to grow as well as if it was in another spot of the garden. So it would be better to put it in the flower garden since the rosebush would receive more sunlight.<n><n>### Input :What is 13 ÷ 2?(Choices: 2, 6, 3, 6 1/3, 7, 7 1/3)<n><n>### Response : The answer is: 6 1/2<n><n>### Reason : Multiplying 1 by 3 (the 13 divided into the 2). Then multiplying 3 by 1/3 (because 6 is 2/3 away from 8.)<n><n><n>### Input  Choices A: 6 + 2 = 8 B: 6 - 2 = 4 C: 6 a<n><n><n>### Reponse  6 + 2 = B<n><n>### My Thoughts. 6 - 2 is different, since A is 6 +2.  A and C is different because A is 6 + 2, and is more than C, which is 6 a.

If a sequence with a previous answer is a correct answer, the following string should represent the same answer as the previous string.<n><n>### Sample Inputs<n>```<n>String.prototype.repeat<n>```<n>1. B<n>```javascript<n>1 * 2<n>```<n>2. C<n>```javascript<n>3 * 4<n>```<n>3. A<n>```javascript<n>5 * 6<n>```<n>4. A<n>```javascript  <n>const string = 'String!' <n><n>const number = 7 <n>const stringWithRepeatedNumber = string.repeat(number) <n>console.Log(stringWithRepeatedNumber) <n>```<n>3. D<n>```javascript<n>const string ='my second' <n><n>const stringRepeat = string.concat(' ') <n>console.log (stringRepeat) <n><n>const stringConcat = string.concat(' String!') <n>console.log("String!", stringConcat) <n>```<n>4. What's the difference between B. being happy and A. laughter?<n><n>Ans: B. being happy is an adjective. It gives the adjective the meaning of being happy, while A. laughter is a noun. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		**B.**<n>1.Demonstrating against an issue is a violent conflict? 😲<n><n>### Input and response:The length of a stick is 4 feet less than the sum of the length of the stick and the length of its shadow.  The length of the stick’s shadow is 12 feet.  What is the length of the stick? Choices: <n>**A.** 30 feet<n>**B.** 28 feet<n>**C.** 26 feet<n>**D.** 240 feet<n>**E.**440 feet<n><n>### Choice:**B.**

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where is a lion likely to live? Choices:  A: veldt B: ocean C: savannah D: africa E: jungle<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### a.<n><n>We know that veldt doesn't have lions.<n><n>So, the safest place for a lion to live is on a savannah, and the second safest is on an african land (jungle).<n><n>#### b.<n><n>We still know that veldt and jungle are not lion-inhabited places.<n><n>Africa was just described as a land for lions, so a savannah lion wouldn't live on an african city, it would live on the african land.<n><n>So, C and E could be eliminated.<n><n>Savannah is still safer than the oceans, we don't know how dangerous an ocean is for lions so we can't fully eliminate the ocean option, but since it is the second most dangerous place, and the second safist is C the we know that the ocean is the least safest.<n><n>#### c.<n><n>The least safest location is a lion's ocean, so let's describe it by negating the previous description.<n><n>Africa is a land that doesn't have lion, so it doesn't have oceans either<n><n>So, we know that it must be C, because that option doesn't have both ocean and Africa.<n><n>Also, since africa is more dangerous for lion, and its safest place is the savannah, we can conclude that C is lions' ocean.<n><n>Also, C might be a river, not an ocean.<n><n>But the lions live on a river, not on the ocean so the only reason lions can be on the oceans would be because there are sharks, and if lions don't have to worry about those animals, they definitely won't worry about humans on the ocean.
