Choices:  A: advertisement B: magazine C: store D: web page E: bus<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demi:<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>![](1.PNG)<n><n>```jsx<n>class App extends React.Component {<n> constructor (props) {<n>   this.state = {name: "Demetre"}<n> }<n> render () {<n>   return (<n>       <div><n>         <h2>{this.state.name}</h2><n>         <Pizza /><n>       </div><n>   )<n> }<n>}<n><n>class Pizza extends React.Component { <n> constructor (props)<n> {<n>   this.ref = React.createRef();<n> }<n> <n> componentDidMount() {<n>   this.refs.target.scrollTo(this.state.position, 0);<n> }<n> update(){<n>  if (this.refs.target.offsetWidth > 50) <n>   this.refs<n>   .target.style.height = this.refs.target<n>  .getBoundingClientRect().height+'px';<n> }<n> render(){<n>   this.update()<n>  return(<n>      <div class="demo-pizza" id="pizza-1" ref={this.ref} onScroll={this.update.bind(this)}><n>  <h4>Growing pizza, you can scroll!</h4><n>  <div class="d-flex justify-content-center align-items-center"><n>        <img src="https://ui-avatars.com/api/?name=Demonstration&color=408D86&background=272727&size=200" /><n>      <h1> Derek Grossman </h1><n>  <p>&nbsp;</p><n>  <h3>JavaScript - React and Redux Fundamentals</h3><n>  <p class = "p-2"><n>    This class contains all of the major ideas that the team at Treehouse wanted to pass on regarding JavaScript and React/Redux. There are no quizzes in this class, as every section should be fully understood before taking the next class.<n>  </p><n></div><n>  <h1> Dishware</h1><n>  </div><n><n>  );<n> }<n>}<n>```<n><n>

The only time this letter will not be in an answer is when the answer is the same as the question (such as 8.1). All other solutions will have this letter in an answer. It is not a part of the actual answer, but rather helps in showing the steps taken to get to the answer.<n><n>### Letter U:Unanswered/Unfinished<n>813\<n>8^13\<n>813^2\<n>8x13^2\

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:After attending school for twelve years what do you do? He is allowed to bring $50 with him for lunch. If he is charged $3 for everything he eats each day that is how much money he will spend on lunch.  How much money does he have left over?<n><n>#### Asker's Task:<n>Write a script that contains the required code to create the application. This should include a user interface to allow the user to enter the price of an item, to ask for the total cost (the sum of all prices) and a summary of the amount left in their bankroll. <n><n># Your Solution:<n>```python<n># Input User <n>value = float(input("Enter item price:"))<n># Main Program<n>lunch_cost = float(value)<n># Calculation<n>balance=float(50)<n>balance = balance - lunch_cost<n>if balane > lunch_cost:<n>    print("Congratulations you have ",value,"$ left over on your bankroll")<n>else:<n>    print("that is not enough your balance is $",balance," now go spend it!")<n>```<n>- [x] This script demonstrates correct functionality. (6.0)<n>- [x] The interface is user friendly and clear. (1.0)<n>

The first term, 2, is called the “first term”.  The second term, 2, 4 is called the “second term”.  Write the first 4 terms in the sequence below.<n><n>2, 4, ___, 12<n><n>### Demontstation:<n>Input: A sequence can be defined as a list of numbers and is called arithmetic progression.<n><n>Output: 3, 7. 9, 13<n><n><n>### Instuctions:The numbers in the square are called terms.  The first term (number in the first box) is called term “0”.  Each number in the upper part (in boxes 1 through 10) is 4 more than the one above it.  Enter the fifth term.<n>

The data is given in pairs.  The pairs consist of the mass of an object in grams (g) and the mass of its sister object in grams (l).  The symbol of the units are written as g and l.  Each object is marked with the symbol of its name and the capital letter indicating which group it belongs to. The symbol of units in each pair are written as a symbol with an equal sign between it and the sister object's symbol.  The mass of each object's sister object is equal to one-half a unit less than the object's mass.  So the mass of an object's sister object will be written like this.<n><n>Group 1 : 50 g and 25 g<n>Group 2: 100 g and 50 l<n>Group 3: 200 g and 100 g<n><n>Write the mass of each object in grams.<n><n>Your Answer: 150 g<n><n>### 2x+5x+9x+6 is equivalent to what?<n><n>2x + 5x + 9x + 6<n><n>### Instructions: Read the passage and answer the questions.<n>Humans can sense sound. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:The teachers needed to get their classrooms ready for the school year. If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Having your marijuana in bags help keep it what? Choices:  A: revealing information B: being ridiculed C: problems D: more funding E: telling all<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n><n>### Input : How do you know when a sequence has a limit?<n><n>**Response :**<n><n><n><n>### Input - 7.<n><n>How do you know when a series has a limit?<n>How do you know if a series has a limit or not?<n><n>**Response -**<n><n><n><n>1.  If there's a pattern. ( Example: Fibonacci sequence)<n>2.  If you can always make the pattern.  ( Example: 10+ x +0.5)<n>3.  If its a geometric progression.<n>4.  If its an A. P ( Arithmetic sequence)<n>5.  If it converges.<n>6.  If its a series.<n><n>### Input 8 -<n><n>Difference to find the limit of a function:<n>  Ex: |2|  if |2| <= K<n>  Ex: |-2| if |2| > K<n><n>### Response :<n><n><n><n>* If the function is in a certain range, or is less than a certain number of x<n><n>### Input- 9<n><n>1.  The number of ways that four boys form six row soccer teams are.  <n>a. 5!<n>b. 4!<n>c. 5x 4! <n><n>(2)(1)(3)(4)<n><n>```<n>3 4 4!<n>4*2 3!<n>2 2 2! <n>0 1 1! <n>1 2 4!<n>```<n><n>2. The total number of possible soccer teams formed by six (not including reserves) boys is: <n>a. 175 <n>b. 648 <n>c. 512 <n>d. 450 <n>e. 424 <n><n>Answer - 5 <n><n>There are 6 possible members for 6 teams. <n><n>### Inputs 10 and 11<n><n>Choose the answer that best represents its position on a number line.<n><n>11. 9/4<n>17. 5^2<n>23. 8<n>39. 11/4<n>55. log 32 = _________.<n><n>```<n>log 32= 2

What is a factor and what is a prime factor of the perimeter of the gym. Factor means the perimeter divided by its summed up factors and Prime factor is the first number when you factorize the perimter. e.g -perimeter of 100= 4+ 5+ 10+25=100 100=2^2<n><n>### Response :The greatest number which divide the perimeter perfectly is called factor, example if perimeter of gym is 36, then prime factor 2, then the number of factors is two and the number of its prime factors is one. In a rectangular shape the factors are perpendicular to each other. <n><n>### Input B :If you were trying to explain to a friend how to draw a cube you would have to give them 6 numbers to tell them which lines to draw to get the right shape in a side view. Which numbers are those, 2,3,4,5,6 and 8?<n><n>**Response from someone :** All sides of the cube are the same length but are shown in different orientations to tell the story of how to draw the cube.<n><n>For example :<n><n>2 sides are 3 units each,<n><n>3 sides are 4 units each, <n><n>4 sides are 5 units each,<n><n>5 sides are 6 units each,<n><n>6 sides are 8 units each and<n><n>8 sides are 2 units each <n><n><n>### Input C :A carpet covering a floor is triangular in shape.<n><n>The number of carpets needed to cover the entire floor is (Fill in the blank) <n>Input : The number of carpets required to cover the entire floor that is rectangular in shape is given. we have to find the number of carpet required for a triangular shaped floor.<n><n>

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where would you buy a ticket to sit in a room with a lot of chairs facing the same direction? How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:What do you need to run after ball? How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n><n>### Response:		<n>C: human body<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A: is false because diseases are spread in ghost towns (the people are isolated).<n><n>B: is false because diseae are not spread in third world countries (they are very clean)<n><n>D: is false because diseaae are not spread in rugs (they are clean and do not have germs).<n><n>E: is false because diseaes are not spread in hospitals (they are very clean).

The loop iterates while the total size of both arrays is less than the length of the small array plus one. The loop ends when the total size of both the elements of the small and large arrays is the same as the length of the small value array plus one.<n><n>Input a set of data where each integer is in the range 1 - 100.<n><n>Display the sum of the elements of both arrays.<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>Write a method, that given a set of integers, finds the largest integer within the whole set. Write a second method that finds the smallest integer within the whole set while taking into account any negative integers as well.<n><n>## Notes<n><n>This activity is an example of an Interview style question asked by some interviewers before they determine if you would be the best team member for the job. I can share 12 with my brother.  I can share them evenly with my brother for dinner tonight.  I still have 3 apples left over.  How many apples did I originally have in my possession exactly?<n><n>### Response<n>Response: Input: I have 29 apples.  I have 3 apples remaining now.  I used the apples and didn't end up with one of anything.  So I had 30 apples.  This is exactly the number of apples I started with. If I gave up 4 to a family member I would still have 26.  You are missing the fact I gave one to my brother.<n><n>### Other Tests 1)  A group of babies was in a photo.  In the photo, they were all the same. There shouldn't be any rules on how much information is provided for one word.<n><n>3)  After their first year of math class, all of their scores increased. Of those who got a perfect score on the test, after one year how much of an increase did their score have compared to those who got a 50%?<n>Answer: I get confused by how to order the variables.  For example do I add them together as a ratio and divide again or do I subtract the number of perfect scores by 140 and then divide by that number to get the percentage?<n><n><n>

This type of change is referred to as title case and does not include capitalizing all letters.  The loop should start at the middle of the first string and change two letters at a time.  The second letter should remain the same.<n><n>### Code:<n>while(string.length!= 0){<n>    if (string[0].length > 1){ string[0] = string[0][0];}<n>    else { string[0] = "l";}<n><n>    string[1] = string[1].toUpperCase();<n>}<n>}<n><n>### Output:<n>Hello This Sentence Has a Long Word<n><n>### Instructions:<n>### Use boolean expressions in a conditional to check the type of a number.<n>### Demonucation:<n><n>let number = 1;<n>if(typeof(number) === "object"){ throw "Error";}<n>```<n><n>### Code<n>if(typeof(typeof(number)) { return "typeof is an object"}<n>```<n><n>## Instruction<n>A:  <n>Write a reponse that can be used as the start of a program.<n><n>## A:<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the question(s) that follow.<n><n>## Instructions and Demonucastiom:<n><n>### Input question:<n>Let’s say you are planning a party at a beach for a small group of friends and you think you’ll want to serve 24 slices of pizza of some sort. The math teacher gave a bonus 15-point question if they turned in an assignment that was on time.  The writing teacher gave a bonus 5-point question if the student turned in their assignment by the due date, regardless of how late they were.  The assignment was worth a total of 150 points.  Mary’s assignment was turned in five seconds late and earned her a minus 10 point.  She earned 20 for on-time, plus 15 for perfect, minus 10 for late, plus her bonus for turning in the paper on time, for a net score of 16 points.  Tom turned his assignment in less than five minutes late and earned a minus 5 points.  He earned 20 points for no penalties on writing, plus 20 for perfect on math, minus 5 for lateness on writing, and minus 5 for his lateness on math.  He earned a net bonus of 11 points.  Did Tom earn more points than Mary?<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>1. Write a response that correctly parses an expression.<n><n>   | Response | Expression | <n>   |:---|:---| <n>   | A | 1+2+3-4 |<n>   | B | (1+2)*3-(4+3) |<n>   | C | 4<5 |<n>   | D | 5>4<7| <n>   | E | 16^3*36>72|<n>   | F | 1 + 1-2*2 * 2 |<n>   | G | (3)/3=1.0|<n>   | H | 5-5>=2|<n>   | I | (7*7 +7- 7) /30 = 5 |<n>   | J | 344>=4|<n>   | K | 7755<=2 |<n>   | L | (5-3)^3-6<10| <n><n>   | Response<n><n><n>### Detailed Solution<n><n>**Input:** The expression is 1+2+2

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65. How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>### Input:Who designs a building? Choices:  A: builders B: driver C: architect D: fall down E: tradesmen<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Create a decision variable named money<n><n>Create two variables with the first variable assigned as “total” and the second as “amount”<n><n>Assign the total variable to be = 1500<n><n>Assign the amount variable to be = 200<n><n>Display a message “Tell me how much money you have”<n><n>Assign “money” to equal the response from the user.<n><n>Display a message: “How many times can you borrow money for a total of 500.00”<n><n>Use the total variable to determine how many times the user can borrow the money.<n><n>Save the amount of money left for use in the future.<n>

Write a response that appropriates completes the task.<n><n>### Question:I'm a student who needs a new laptop. I've got two laptops at home, but they're starting to show some wear and tear. I'm shopping around for a new used laptop. If I can find a new used machine for less than $700, I'll buy it tomorrow. If I can find one for less than $600, I'm considering it. But if it's more than $500, then that's outside the price range for my current budget.<n><n>What's the highest price I can pay for a new used laptop?<n><n>#### Find a NEW laptop<n><n>- **1st method:**  <n>```<n>    if total == $700  <n>    print('Highest i can pay for laptop')<n>```<n><n>- **2nd method:**  <n>- **3rd method:**  <n><n>#### Find a used laptop <n>- **1st:**  <n>```python<n>if total == $705:  <n>    print('used')<n>```<n><n>---------------------------------------------------------------<n>
